Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How well do I connect a problem to its business impact?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: Which risk tool did I apply recently to plan contingencies?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: Whom did I coach to improve their problem-solving approach?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: What systemic change did I influence as a result of my analysis?
Which recent cross-team conflict did I help resolve positively?
How often do I involve clients or vendors early in alignment?
Do I communicate through digital tools clearly and consistently?
How often do I mentor others to collaborate better?
What word would peers use to describe my role in cross-team trust?
What outcomes did I own beyond my direct control?
Did I communicate proactively when plans changed?
How did I handle accountability when results went wrong?
What behavior from me made others feel safe to own their part?
What will I do next quarter to strengthen ethical reliability?
When communicating strategy updates, how often do you explain why a change matters to multiple functions, not just what changes?
How often do you adapt the same message for both technical and business teams so each understands their role?
When priorities shift, how often do you highlight trade-offs and help others see the bigger picture?
How often do you restate vision or end goals when teams lose focus or momentum?
(New hybrid fix) When working with distributed or client teams, how often do you clarify shared objectives to keep alignment across time zones or channels?
How often do you re-frame your ideas to address each stakeholder’s unique priorities?
When two teams disagree, how often do you mediate using shared data rather than opinions?
How often do you gain consensus without escalation to senior leadership?
When dependencies span functions, how often do you ensure both sides commit explicitly to timelines?
After discussions, how often do you document the final decision to prevent confusion later?
How often do you seek senior feedback before finalizing communication that impacts multiple groups?
How often do you synthesize feedback themes (not isolated comments) before acting?
During high-pressure meetings, how often do you acknowledge others’ viewpoints before presenting yours?
When leadership challenges your plan, how often do you listen fully and recalibrate respectfully?
How often do you ensure external partners’ or clients’ voices are accurately represented inside Sails discussions?
When using data, how often do you turn numbers into a short story that shows impact and meaning?
How often do you stay composed and clear while handling difficult leadership questions?
How often do you structure presentations as Purpose → Evidence → Action for clarity?
How often do you use empathy and brevity to connect emotionally yet stay professional?
(New digital fix) How often do you choose the right digital channel (chat, mail, meeting) to match urgency and audience?
How often do you mentor peers or juniors to improve clarity and impact?
How often do you set standards for communication cadence and tone within your function?
How often do you coach peers on tailoring messages for executives versus clients?
How often do you publicly recognize transparent, respectful communication in your team?
How often do you model calm, concise messaging even during high-stress moments?
Which message this quarter most influenced team direction – why?
When did miscommunication delay a decision – what could change?
Do I adjust tone across levels (peers, leaders, clients)?
Who gave me feedback on communication impact recently?
How do I model transparent communication culture?
How do I help clients or partners adapt smoothly during transitions?
When did I last turn a failed experiment into a shared success story?
How have I helped my team stay energized through uncertainty?
What learning or innovation emerged from our last big change?
How am I spreading adaptability lessons across the organization?

Question: When a cross-department issue arises, how often do you first restate the core problem so all teams agree on what’s being solved?

Question: How often do you involve client or vendor partners to understand how their priorities affect the problem definition? (CAPA #01)

Question: How often do you link each problem to a specific business metric (e.g., customer NPS, cost, cycle time)?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you differentiate between symptoms and root causes before suggesting solutions?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you facilitate alignment sessions so stakeholders converge on a single definition of success?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you use dashboards or datasets to identify patterns instead of relying on opinions?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you quantify an issue’s scale (% defects, downtime, cost impact) before acting?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: When data is incomplete, how often do you run small-scale tests to validate assumptions?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you coach teams to read and interpret data collectively?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you use trend insights to predict and mitigate emerging risks?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you present multiple solution paths with pros and cons and impact analysis to leaders?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you apply transparent criteria (cost, time, risk, client value) before final decisions?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you document decision rationales so others understand why a path was chosen?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you include client or cross-function feedback to strengthen your decision logic? (CAPA #01 reinforced)

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you balance innovation (new ideas) with process stability (proven methods)?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you map interdependencies that could affect solution success?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you use a structured tool (SWOT, FMEA, Risk Matrix) to evaluate risks before execution? (CAPA #02)

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: When risks surface, how often do you stay calm and lead a structured response review?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you capture and share lessons learned so other teams benefit?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you flag upstream and downstream impacts of your team’s choices?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you help peers reframe problems rather than give ready answers?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you recognize and celebrate sound problem-solving by others?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you conduct post-mortems to convert failures into learning?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you challenge recurring issues with a “why does this persist?” mindset?

Category: Self assesment Problem Solving & Critical Thinking
Question: How often do you mentor teams to use data and insight for decisions on their own?
When initiating joint work with another function, how often do you clarify shared goals and success metrics?
How often do you plan communication flows between functions to avoid misalignment?
How often do you share background context so partner teams understand the “why” behind decisions?
When projects involve clients or vendors, how often do you proactively align internal and external expectations before execution? (CAPA 01)
When priorities clash between teams, how often do you facilitate a mutual agreement that benefits both sides instead of escalating?
How often do you begin discussions with facts and data before opinions?
How often do you stay neutral and focus on issues rather than personalities?
How often do you turn disagreement into collaboration by clarifying shared goals?
In multi-vendor projects, how often do you mediate conflicting interests so deliverables stay on track?
How often do you document agreements and follow up to ensure lasting resolution?
How often do you gain co-operation from teams without formal authority?
How often do you deliver on commitments to reinforce credibility?
How often do you publicly acknowledge partners’ contributions?
When introducing a change, how often do you communicate impact and listen to concerns?
How often do you ensure follow-through on joint decisions until closure?
How often do you include remote and offshore members in decisions proactively?
How often do you coordinate time zones and meeting slots to enable equal voice?
How often do you post clear summaries or updates in shared channels after discussions?
How often do you avoid duplicate work by using shared repositories and global trackers?
How often do you use Teams, Slack, or project channels to drive asynchronous alignment without meeting fatigue?
How often do you mentor junior leaders to handle collaborative decisions?
How often do you model respectful debate in public forums?
How often do you recognize cross-team efforts that enabled success?
How often do you create safe spaces for learning from mistakes collectively?
How often do you sponsor initiatives that strengthen cross-functional bonding?
How often do you meet delivery commitments even when priorities shift?
How often do you proactively inform stakeholders if a commitment is at risk?
How often do you ensure visibility of progress and blockers through dashboards or reports?
When assuming new responsibilities, how often do you negotiate realistic timelines before committing?
How often do you ensure all meeting actions are completed without follow-up reminders?
How often do you take joint accountability for cross-functional results, not just your team’s tasks?
How often do you facilitate post-mortems that drive systemic improvement rather than individual blame?
How often do you enable alignment meetings when outcomes depend on multiple functions?
How often do you verify inter-team dependencies before they turn into delivery delays?
How often do you communicate shared responsibility clearly to internal or client stakeholders?
How often do you make transparent decisions even under time pressure?
How often do you take ownership of errors made under your supervision and correct them publicly?
When commercial goals and compliance conflict, how often do you escalate responsibly and document decisions?
How often do you insist on accuracy and truthfulness in client or audit reporting?
How often do you create awareness of ethical expectations among team members?
How often do you identify potential risks during planning rather than execution?
How often do you maintain an updated risk/mitigation tracker for your projects?
How often do you take personal accountability for resolving critical incidents end-to-end?
How often do you communicate mitigation status to leadership without waiting for escalation?
How often do you convert learnings from issues into preventive standards or playbooks?
How often do you delegate with clarity on outcomes, authority, and support?
How often do you publicly recognize others for demonstrating strong accountability?
How often do you coach peers to link their daily work to organizational impact?
How often do you address failures as shared learning moments, not fault finding?
How often do you mentor next-level leaders to take full ownership of their decisions?
How often do you scan client, market, or technology trends to foresee shifts that could impact your projects?
When organizational change is announced, how often do you translate what it means and why it matters for your team?
How often do you frame upcoming changes as opportunities for improvement rather than threats?
When ambiguity arises, how often do you clarify what’s known, what’s uncertain, and what comes next to reduce confusion?
How often do you proactively brief peers or clients on possible changes before official communication?
How often do you create space for your team to try new ideas or pilot small process improvements?
When a pilot fails, how often do you help the team capture lessons instead of assigning blame?
How often do you share insights or results from experiments with other functions for learning reuse?
How often do you encourage peer-to-peer learning or mini retrospectives after major deliverables?
How often do you measure the results of learning (e.g., faster adoption, improved quality, reduced errors)?
When priorities change mid-project, how often do you realign goals while maintaining delivery timelines?
How often do you choose between agile or structured methods based on team and client needs?
How often do you make thoughtful trade-offs between short-term fixes and long-term resilience?
How often do you adjust plans quickly based on real-time client or market feedback?
How often do you explain the reasons behind changes so everyone understands the “why” before acting?
How often do you detect early signs of fatigue or stress within the team and take preventive action?
How often do you remain calm and constructive when faced with sudden change or pressure?
How often do you balance workloads and priorities to protect team well-being during transitions?
When conflict or tension rises, how often do you initiate reset conversations to regain focus?
How often do you celebrate small milestones to maintain morale through prolonged change?
How often do you share change-related lessons or best practices with other departments or partner teams?
How often do you invite cross-functional experts to share their “how we adapted” stories?
How often do you use digital collaboration tools (e.g., Teams, Slack, Wiki) to ensure distributed or remote teams stay aligned and learn from each other?
How often do you mentor peers or clients to strengthen their adaptability and learning practices?
How often do you capture and document learnings into reusable playbooks for future transitions?
